verses.kjv: Saul reigned one year; and when he had reigned two years over Israel,
verses.ct: Saul was 30 years old when he became king, and he ruled over Israel for 42 years.

verses.kjv: Saul chose him three thousand men of Israel; whereof two thousand were with Saul in Michmash and in mount Bethel, and a thousand were with Jonathan in Gibeah of Benjamin: and the rest of the people he sent every man to his tent.
verses.ct: Saul selected 3,000 men from Israel. 2,000 of them stayed with Saul at Michmash and in the hill country of Bethel, while 1,000 were stationed with Jonathan at Gibeah in Benjamin. He sent the rest of the troops home.

verses.kjv: And Jonathan smote the garrison of the Philistines that was in Geba, and the Philistines heard of it. And Saul blew the trumpet throughout all the land, saying, Let the Hebrews hear.
verses.ct: Jonathan attacked the Philistine outpost at Geba, and the Philistines found out about it. Then Saul had trumpets blown throughout the whole land, announcing, "Let the Hebrews hear this!"

verses.kjv: And all Israel heard say that Saul had smitten a garrison of the Philistines, and that Israel also was had in abomination with the Philistines. And the people were called together after Saul to Gilgal.
verses.ct: All of Israel got the news that Saul had struck a Philistine outpost, and that the Philistines now despised Israel. So the people were summoned to join Saul at Gilgal.

verses.kjv: And the Philistines gathered themselves together to fight with Israel, thirty thousand chariots, and six thousand horsemen, and people as the sand which is on the sea shore in multitude: and they came up, and pitched in Michmash, eastward from Bethaven.
verses.ct: The Philistines assembled to fight against Israel with 30,000 chariots, 6,000 cavalry, and foot soldiers as countless as sand on the seashore. They advanced and set up camp at Michmash, east of Beth-aven.

verses.kjv: When the men of Israel saw that they were in a strait, (for the people were distressed,) then the people did hide themselves in caves, and in thickets, and in rocks, and in high places, and in pits.
verses.ct: When the Israelite men realized how desperate their situation was — because the army was overwhelmed — the people hid themselves in caves, thickets, among rocks, in underground shelters, and in cisterns.

verses.kjv: And some of the Hebrews went over Jordan to the land of Gad and Gilead. As for Saul, he was yet in Gilgal, and all the people followed him trembling.
verses.ct: Some Hebrews even crossed the Jordan River into the territory of Gad and Gilead. Saul remained at Gilgal, but all the troops with him were shaking with fear.

verses.kjv: And he tarried seven days, according to the set time that Samuel had appointed: but Samuel came not to Gilgal; and the people were scattered from him.
verses.ct: He waited 7 days, the time that Samuel had specified. But Samuel did not arrive at Gilgal, and the soldiers began deserting him.

verses.kjv: And Saul said, Bring hither a burnt offering to me, and peace offerings. And he offered the burnt offering.
verses.ct: So Saul said, "Bring me the burnt offering and the peace offerings." Then he presented the burnt offering himself.

verses.kjv: And it came to pass, that as soon as he had made an end of offering the burnt offering, behold, Samuel came; and Saul went out to meet him, that he might salute him.
verses.ct: Just as he finished presenting the burnt offering, Samuel arrived. Saul went out to greet him.

verses.kjv: And Samuel said, What hast thou done? And Saul said, Because I saw that the people were scattered from me, and that thou camest not within the days appointed, and that the Philistines gathered themselves together at Michmash;
verses.ct: Samuel asked, "What have you done?" Saul replied, "I saw that the troops were deserting me, and you hadn't come within the time you set, and the Philistines were gathering at Michmash.

verses.kjv: Therefore said I, The Philistines will come down now upon me to Gilgal, and I have not made supplication unto the LORD: I forced myself therefore, and offered a burnt offering.
verses.ct: "So I thought, 'The Philistines are about to attack me here at Gilgal, and I haven't sought the LORD's favor.' I felt compelled, so I presented the burnt offering myself."

verses.kjv: And Samuel said to Saul, Thou hast done foolishly: thou hast not kept the commandment of the LORD thy God, which he commanded thee: for now would the LORD have established thy kingdom upon Israel for ever.
verses.ct: Samuel told Saul, "You have acted foolishly. You have not obeyed the command that the LORD your God gave you. If you had, the LORD would have established your dynasty over Israel permanently.

verses.kjv: But now thy kingdom shall not continue: the LORD hath sought him a man after his own heart, and the LORD hath commanded him to be captain over his people, because thou hast not kept that which the LORD commanded thee.
verses.ct: "But now your dynasty will not last. The LORD has found a man whose heart is fully aligned with his own, and the LORD has appointed him as ruler over his people, because you did not obey what the LORD commanded you."

verses.kjv: And Samuel arose, and gat him up from Gilgal unto Gibeah of Benjamin. And Saul numbered the people that were present with him, about six hundred men.
verses.ct: Then Samuel left Gilgal and went up to Gibeah in Benjamin. Saul counted the soldiers still with him — about 600 men.

verses.kjv: And Saul, and Jonathan his son, and the people that were present with them, abode in Gibeah of Benjamin: but the Philistines encamped in Michmash.
verses.ct: Saul, his son Jonathan, and the troops remaining with them stayed at Gibeah in Benjamin, while the Philistines were camped at Michmash.

verses.kjv: And the spoilers came out of the camp of the Philistines in three companies: one company turned unto the way that leadeth to Ophrah, unto the land of Shual:
verses.ct: Raiding parties went out from the Philistine camp in 3 groups. One group headed toward Ophrah in the region of Shual.

verses.kjv: And another company turned the way to Bethhoron: and another company turned to the way of the border that looketh to the valley of Zeboim toward the wilderness.
verses.ct: A second group headed toward Beth-horon, and a third group headed toward the border overlooking the Valley of Zeboim near the wilderness.

verses.kjv: Now there was no smith found throughout all the land of Israel: for the Philistines said, Lest the Hebrews make them swords or spears:
verses.ct: Now there wasn't a single metalworker in all of Israel, because the Philistines had said, "We can't let the Hebrews make swords or spears."

verses.kjv: But all the Israelites went down to the Philistines, to sharpen every man his share, and his coulter, and his axe, and his mattock.
verses.ct: So all the Israelites had to go down to the Philistines to get their plowshares, cutting blades, axes, and hoes sharpened.

verses.kjv: Yet they had a file for the mattocks, and for the coulters, and for the forks, and for the axes, and to sharpen the goads.
verses.ct: The charge was 2/3 of a shekel for sharpening plowshares and cutting blades, and 1/3 of a shekel for sharpening forks, axes, and ox goads.

verses.kjv: So it came to pass in the day of battle, that there was neither sword nor spear found in the hand of any of the people that were with Saul and Jonathan: but with Saul and with Jonathan his son was there found.
verses.ct: So when the day of battle came, not a single soldier with Saul and Jonathan had a sword or spear — only Saul and his son Jonathan had them.

verses.kjv: And the garrison of the Philistines went out to the passage of Michmash.
verses.ct: Meanwhile, a Philistine detachment moved out to secure the pass at Michmash.
